I want to add my idea onto this idea (rather than creating a separate concept of a Mountain Fortress)

I think there should be a 4th version: a defended fortress. It can be as rare as it needs to be to avoid upsetting gameplay balance. But I want a defended fortress to contain an active nether portal somewhere inside it and have that portal align with a Nether chunk that contains the max number of ancient debris (currently 6)

I *HATE* mining for ancient debris. It is absolutely no fun randomly blowing up beds in nether rack and just looking around to see if anything useful happened. If I could instead explore the Overworld, find a fortress to conquer and have the prize be a pinpointed location of a rich Nether chunk, that would be loads of fun.

If "some important people" were to get really ambitious, adding a Raid aspect to the fortress assault would be even better. We have Village Defense Raids; it would be really cool if we could get Fortress Assault Raids. The vision I have in my head for the fortress would be 4 stone motif Pillager Outposts set up in a square, connected by rampart walls, and a central Keep tower that has the portal at the top. Storm the castle, climb the stairs, portal to Nether, mine for the prize.

üéÆ Title:

‚ÄúTouch Control Customization Locked to 'Open Screen' After Update in Minecraft‚Äù

---

üìù Feedback / Complaint to Mojang:

> Dear Mojang Team,

After the recent update, I noticed that the touch control customization option is now restricted and only available on the 'open screen'. This change is very inconvenient for mobile players like me.

Before this update, we could freely customize controls at any time, whether in the main menu or during gameplay. Now, having to go to a specific screen just to rearrange or tweak buttons makes the game less flexible and user-friendly.

For many players, especially those who rely on customized layouts for better PvP, building, or general gameplay, this limitation significantly affects the experience.

I kindly request you to bring back the ability to customize controls at any time, just like before. This small change had a big impact, and restoring the old behavior would make many players happy.

Thank you for listening to your community!

‚Äì A Concerned Minecraft Player

I‚Äôve tried to be patient, but it‚Äôs time to be clear:
The new fog effect introduced in 1.21.6 hurts the experience and hurts our eyes and the worst part is that it‚Äôs not optional.

Since this update, everything in the distance looks gray, washed out, and blurred. Flying around now feels like being stuck in a chlorine-filled indoor pool. It‚Äôs uncomfortable to look at and genuinely causes eye strain, especially after long play sessions.
When playing for hours, this forces us to focus much harder than before, which is exhausting and unhealthy. In dark oak forests during thunderstorms, it gets so bad that you can barely see anything.

This is more than a visual preference it‚Äôs a comfort and accessibility issue. Not everyone can or wants to install mods just to remove something that could easily be a setting.

Minecraft has always been about player freedom and choice. So why are we being forced into a single visual style with no way to adjust it? There are already hundreds of votes on this feedback thread, and plenty of players (including myself) are staying on 1.21.5 just to avoid this fog.
